}

Putting it all together. 

Now, the full C code:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    int n, a, b, c;
    scanf("%d %d %d %d", &n, &a, &b, &c);
    
    // First part: compute dp[n]
    const int maxn = 4010;
    int dp[maxn];
    for (int i = 0; i < maxn; i++) {
        dp[i] = -2147483648;
    }
    dp[0] = 0;
    int arr[3] = {a, b, c};
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
        int coin = arr[i];
        for (int j = coin; j < maxn; j++) {
            if (dp[j - coin] + 1 > dp[j]) {
                dp[j] = dp[j - coin] + 1;
            }
        }
    }
    int result = dp[n];
    
    // Convert result to string
    char s[20];
    sprintf(s, "%d", result);
    int N = strlen(s);
    
    // Second part: process the string
    int mod_arr[N];
    int mod_cnt[2019] = {0};
    int radix = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        int pos = N - 1 - i;
        int digit = s[pos] - '0';
        int tmp = (digit * radix) % 2019;
        if (i != 0) {
            tmp = (tmp + mod_arr[i - 1]) % 2019;
        }
        mod_arr[i] = tmp;
        mod_cnt[tmp]++;
        radix = (radix * 10) % 2019;
    }
    mod_cnt[0]++; // as per the Java code
    
    long long ans = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < 2019; i++) {
        ans += (long long) mod_cnt[i] * (mod_cnt[i] - 1) / 2;
    }
    printf("%lld\n", ans);
    
    return 0;
}

Assuming that the problem constraints for the first program are such that n is up to 4010, so the code is okay.
